Comparison of the claim with past State: The expert compared the claim to previous State of the Union addresses and noted that traditionally, every speaker has said something very similar to "Members of Congress, I have the high privilege and the distinct honor of presenting to you the president of the United States." This comparison helps verify the authenticity of the claim.
Video evidence of Pelosi: s introduction: The expert mentioned that in the video of the 2019 State of the Union address, it appeared that Trump started his speech before Pelosi could formally introduce him. This video evidence supports the claim that Pelosi deviated from the traditional introduction.
Confirmation by CNN host Jake Tapper: The expert cited a tweet by CNN host Jake Tapper, who noted the deviation in Pelosi's introduction during his post-speech analysis. Tapper's confirmation adds credibility to the claim.
Pelosi: s own statement: The expert mentioned that Pelosi introduced Trump at the 2020 State of the Union speech by saying, "Members of Congress, the president of the United States." This statement by Pelosi herself directly supports the claim made in the original statement.
